website_summaries.verdict: This preamp's rugged design and quality operation is even backed by a 1-year warranty.
pros: Simple, strong, and elegant design, without any power LED (an annoyance for equipment that can't be turned off)
The Pyle will raise any weak phono-level signal to line level, and even includes a 1-year warranty
cons: Some customers have reported a hum at higher volumes, due to poor grounding

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little box! Recommend
customer_reviews.text: With proper grounding, this little preamp box has almost NO hum. Brought my records back to life :) turntable sounded tinny and quiet and this really helps counteract the RIAA curve nicely, and now my records sound the way the artist intended. A plus of it being so compact is that it looks great while taking up around 2x4 inches of space:) really recommend this product instead of spending insane amounts of cash on something that does essentially the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: but it worked beautifully right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this would work for my application, but it worked beautifully right out of the box. I have a vintage HH Scott stereo amplifier and wanted to add music streaming to it via a simple Bluetooth receiver. When I connect that up, I found the receiver's output to be to low in voltage. By inserting the Pyle preamp between the receiver and the Scott amplifier, the resulting signal input to the amplifier was up to line level and the music played through this Bluetooth connection is clear and full fidelity. The Pyle preamp is a great little product at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, works great for the price point
customer_reviews.text: After finally upgrading from a 2 channel stereo to a surround sound receiver, I was left without a phono input. I wasn't looking to spend alot since I plan to update my turntable to one with a line out. Easy to hook up, worked right out of the box. No hum due to the grounding connector. The sound quality is ok for the price point. A volume knob (or small POT) would have been nice, but not necessary. An on/off switch also would have been nice, but it's easy enough to unplug.
customer_reviews.author: ccarl03

customer_reviews.title: Easy way out
customer_reviews.text: So I got a new receiver but forgot to check that it had a phono input. It didn't! Now what? My 40 year old turntable did not have pre-amp but I came across this little wonder. Instead of sending back my new receiver or buying a new turntable, admittedly that was looked at strongly given the age of my current table, I spent around $20 and voila everything came together. Took less than 2 minutes to hook up.Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Goodtimes

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Didn't need something expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Bought a turntable for my hubby for Christmas last year. He bought me a new receiver. His turntable worked with the old receiver but not the new. Read we needed a pre-amp. Wasn't sure if an inexpensive one would work. Was worried about this one because it seemed to require a ground wire, which his turntable doesn't have. Connected it to the turntable, realized I needed another set of red/white connectors to go to the receiver. Luckily, I had a set lying around. Plugged it in and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: JA KlingTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: My old preamp, a Pfantine Solid State, had a terrible buzz I couldn’t get rid of. I searched Amazon and based on reviews and a prior purchase years ago of a Pyle iPod base-to-stereo device that worked great, I ordered this Pyle PP999. It arrived the next day (Prime). I hooked it up to my 80’s Technics SL-BD22, and buzz completely gone, and sound quality vastly improved. Well packaged; Good instructions; Compact. Well worth the modest price.
customer_reviews.author: JJK Bard Fan

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Simple, Great little Pre-Amp to connect your turntable
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a Phono Pre-Amp for my turntable. My turntable had a built-in pre-amp but it sometimes when playing the right speaker would cut out. I think because it was grounded. My receiver also didn't have a Phono input. So I wanted a compact but good pre-amp to make my turntable a Phono input instead of a Line input and have it be connected to the ground. So I have my turntable connected to the pre-amp and then connected that to the line input of the receiver. It works great! It's compact and simple and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Moon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have this setup to a U-Turn Orbit table and then connected to the Aux port via RCA->Aux into a Vizio 5.1 soundbar system. My setup is no audiophile setup that's for sure. However, for the casual listener and those who aren't going to nitpick quality to death this does the job. It gives more than enough sound and the quality is there as well. Great for the price, but if you're looking to have studio setup you already know not to buy this
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Phono preamp works very well.
customer_reviews.text: No problem using this with a moving magnet cartridge on an old B.I.C. turntable. Good bass so I'll assume it meets the RIAA equalization standard. Very little hum even at extreme volume levels, none detectable at normal volume. My turntable had RCA type output jacks that I had to clean oxidation off to make them usable. Check to see if your amp or receiver has a switched A/C outlet on the back. If so, you can use it to turn off the preamp when it's not being used. This is a great little preamp at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Man

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate product and even more terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was fine, did its job with low noise. The problem for me came after a month of use, the right channel of the device simply stopped working. At first, I was afraid my speaker or the outputs on my turntable gave out, but after testing them, I realized it was the preamp itself. I contacted Pyle and spent $10 shipping the device to them and back, only for them to send me back the exact same preamp with the exact same problem. Do yourself a favor, don't buy from this company, they have terrible customer service and very unreliable products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: This came without the adapter and I was going to return it, but before going to the trouble of that, II decided to try it using one of my own adapters of the same voltage. My phono player didn't work using that adapter, so I tried a different one, and the phono worked, so I didn't return this Preamp. It works well and I'm happy with it. However, I didn't get what I paid for, as it was supposed to have an adapter included. I won't use this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: ringztrue

customer_reviews.title: Compact, inexpensive and does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I bought a beautiful used Sony turntable long ago and finally got around to connecting it to my sound system. That's when I determined I needed a preamp to drive it. I turned to Amazon as I frequently do and found the Pyle PP999. Within two days it arrived and in moments I had it installed. Easy Peazy. It's so small I can hide it behind the receiver. The cost was great. The vinyl I've been wanting to listen to - for lack of a preamp - really sounds terrific. I'm pleased that there's no hum or distortion. I highly recommend Pyle for a quick, simple and inexpensive fix when needing a preamp.
customer_reviews.author: fabiocat

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased - The Pyle Pro Pre-Amp is cost and space effective!
customer_reviews.text: Received my Pyle Pre-Amp yesterday. I had been using the Pre-Amp within a 37 year old Integrated Amplifier, an equally old Turntable and a Windows laptop to digitize vinyl. Within an hour, not only had I replaced the 33 lb. 18" by 6" by 14" amplifier with a device about the size and weight of a deck of play cards, but I'd digitized the Beatles Second Album! The device works exactly as described. While it would be nice to an have on/off switch and volume control, assuming the pre-amp works for the duration of the warranty, I'll have gotten far more than I paid for!
customer_reviews.author: Lakeside Lily

customer_reviews.title: Left Out Channel not working right
customer_reviews.text: when i receive this unit i didn't have the chance to give it a real test till today and i realize that the Left Out Channel is not working properly and i have to place it vertically on the ground so that I can hear sound from the left side ! i'm not satisfied from this devise not sure if it was any good for my turntable. i not recommend to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: moutaz mattar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Pre Amp that works great
customer_reviews.text: When my receiver died I had to connect my 1970's vintage turntable to my digital receiver. Doing so required buying a Pre Amp. The Pyle PP999 was well reviewed on Amazon and reasonably priced, so I gave it a try. Two days later it arrived. It is about the size of a deck of cards and easily fits behind other stereo components. Well packaged with clear instructions, setup was a breeze. Thirty seconds later I was playing records through the digital receiver with no issues. Thank you Pyle, well done.
customer_reviews.author: allyk

customer_reviews.title: It is very simple.  RCA cable from turntable in to RCA cable to amp
customer_reviews.text: I loved the simplicity of this device. The fact that it does not have a on off switch does not bother me. It is small and is housed in a metal chassis. It is strong. It produces a more than adequate signal to my Emotiva amplifier. The signal from the pp999 is low distortion and sounds great. I have two SEAS 6 inch woofer and SEAS tweeters with my Emotiva amp from my Project Debut Carbon turntable with 2m Red Ortofon cartridge. The sound is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D. Senechal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect, I looked online to figure out what I needed because I had no clue. and ran into a dozen over the budget priced preamps. I’m not about to spend that kind of money on vinyl sound. Then I found this Pyle. Easy to install (3 minutes)price is fabulous, and so is the sound. No hums ticks just good sound. I was happy it also has a ground. I hooked my technics circa 1980 turntable to a Sony Blu-ray, with my Bose speaker wires modified to fit the Sony and voila I’m in business.
customer_reviews.author: Lili

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about 2 weeks now. I really wasn't expecting much. I run 2 turntables and use this with my Marantz that I bought in '82. I was surprised at the sound quality. Sounds like I have it plugged into the phono jacks on my receiver. No hum or noise of any kind. I bought this to 'hold me over' till I buy the Schiit Mani. For $14 you can't go wrong with this one. Not Audiophile quality but definitely does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: RCA jacks are small
customer_reviews.text: The price is right and it sounds pretty good. The only downside is that the RCA jacks are smaller than they should be - by just a hair. I had to squeeze the cable connectors to keep them from falling off. This isn't cable specific. I tried with three different sets of cables that all fit my receiver inputs just fine; they all were too loose on the component input and output jacks.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: It may be cheap, which makes it attractive, but it's not worth it. The power supply was intermittent. I used my power supply and it made work for 5 minutes and then it quit working altogether. First one channel went and soon thereafter the other channel. I bought a more expensive one from another brand. I returned this one and got my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: Pyle preamp worked fine at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Apparently as technology moved from vinyl records to tapes and CDs, manufacturerers stopped including pre-amps in stereo receivers. The preamp increases the very small signal from the turntable's needle. When I couldn't get reasonable volume from my new stereo receiver, I realized what was wrong. Rather than returning the receiver, I purchased the pre-amp for about $20 more. Between the two I am now getting excellent sound. If I had to do it over, I would have been more careful to assure that the receiver included a pre-amp, but I am not unhappy with how it all turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E.

customer_reviews.title: Compact, well built, user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and was so excited to use on my old Technics turn table. I soon found out I needed the male-to-male audio cord in order to attach it to my TV, so make sure you get that as well since this does not come with it! It merely comes with the power cord for an outlet and that's it. Didn't want to wait forever with Amazon and lucked out getting a 6' cord from Lowe's for $5. Overall, it's super compact and the metal looks sturdy so I'm happy. I don't have another to compare with but works for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.author: Kelly H

customer_reviews.title: Price says it all
customer_reviews.text: Functional but it just isn't made to last. Can stand in until you save for a better preamp but I wouldn't ask much more from it. Ground screw stripped out after a while and it was only used once to attach the wire upon installation. Audio cables often came unplugged. I swapped cables and swapped which ends were plugged into the preamp. The end plugged into the turntable never had that problem. The setup was stationary so it's not like the equipment was moved around or unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you can in fact afford 60-100 bucks for a pre amp do yourself a favor and go with the lower budget pre amps from well known Hi-Fi manufacturers. That’s what I did after realizing that cheaping out on a pre amp while using a $300 turntable made no sense at all. If $20 is all you can afford then by all means, try it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Maybe will work better with a proper power amp
customer_reviews.text: Don't think you're going to be rocking with this. It works, but is not strong enough to get any decent volume through a modern surround sound type of receiver. Maybe will work better with a proper power amp? Not sure. Update: wasn't very loud with my old Sony 5.1 system, but I have since picked up a Yamaha HTR 5740 and with that receiver, this thing does just fine! Volume is plenty.
customer_reviews.author: joebor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up an old Kenwood turntable and was in need of a phono preamp. Went to Amazon and found this Pyle preamp. Ordered it and received it the next day. Hooked it up and started enjoying all the old vinyl albums I had. I'm no audiophile but they sound good through this preamp. For the price and quality of sound, I'm very satisfied on this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pre-amp for a vintage stereo with a phono input that no longer works. I’d have to crank the volume up around 50 to 75% just to hear anything. This pre-amp lets me get good volume from my turntable at only 20%, on par with the CD player hooked up to the stereo too. I can also finally hear bass on my records. This model is compact and fits nicely between my stereo and turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Audio clarity.
customer_reviews.text: OK I was excited to try this Pyle preamp. I have read the many mixed reviews. well mine falls into the Pyle of Crap 1 Star review. It sounds terrible, very low quality sound, static and muted. I have a mm stylus and a very good Sony turntable. I changed final amps and needed a preamp now. This was very underwhelming.I checked my Stylus connection, changed out all the RCA cables input and output. Grounded the unit to several different locations. #Fail. I will be buying a better quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: David Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Very low output, very low quality sound
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. This phono preamp has almost no output at all. I have to turn my receiver up to 7 just to hear my turntable play a record at a low listening level, as compared to my CD player which I only have to turn up to 3. Also, the sound quality is very poor, very "thin". There's no bass at all. I'm returning this and getting something better. You definitely "get what you pay for".
customer_reviews.author: Blargh

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: This small incredibly easy to hook up unit does a superb job of converting my Philps 212 Turntable output to be compatible with AUX input standards to fix both volume and frequency response characteristics required to play 33 and 45 RPM records perfectly. The signal is clear, rich and "hum" free. This supplier has an excellent price and had it in my hands within 24 hours!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I recently received as a gift an inexpensive turntable to use for converting vinyl records to CD. I noticed the turntable put out mostly treble and not a lot of bass and could use some help. This little preamp definitely did the trick. It's simple and easy to use and with the price reduced from $33 to $14 how could you go wrong? The turntable put outs a signal strength of 1/1000 of a volt and this amp boosts the signal to a full 1 volt.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Smithhart

customer_reviews.title: I guess when you buy the cheapest unit you find ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess when you buy the cheapest unit you find you can’t expect audiophile quality. It does work so if you just want to listen to your records then go ahead and get this one. I’ll be buying another one or borrowing one just to be sure but the output is lower than I hoped for. I really need to crank it up to listen at normal volume and that creates a little noise.
customer_reviews.author: Shamdog

customer_reviews.title: Power adapter DOA
customer_reviews.text: Item showed up fast but was DOA the wall adapter does not work, the amp works fine but with another adapter, kind of disappointing but not really considering the price, sound quality is acceptable for the price. No humming or weird noises. If you buy one hopefully it comes with a working wall adapter
customer_reviews.author: jon henry

customer_reviews.title: Good as a first preamp
customer_reviews.text: If you just got a turntable that needs a preamp and want to get it working... This one works great for the price. Very good value. At some point I will probably upgrade to something better, but honestly... This was way better than I expected for as cheap as it is.
customer_reviews.author: The_Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Sounded fine for a few months... then it died
customer_reviews.text: Never tried it in the studio (treated room and monitors) but was fine for the living room on a consumer 2.1 system, however... it lasted less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: NameBetterThanYours

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, solid preamp for my father in law.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for this price. You would have to spend more for a TC-750 to get noticably better performance. I did a short comparison of this Pyle verses the TC-750. The TC-750 phono preamp was easily noticably better, but it's twice the price. The Pyle PP999 didn't have any hum or anything weird when I tried it in my system. Can't complain about this one. Great for casual listening or a gift or second room.
customer_reviews.author: cafe80s

customer_reviews.title: Works great with our turntable
customer_reviews.text: We needed a pre-amp to connect our turntable to our TV sound bar. I took some time researching options, but kept going back to this one. The only reason I hesitated was because somehow I had in my head that I needed to spend more money to get sound quality. Boy was I wrong. I connected the RCA cables with ground wire from my turntable to this pre-amp, then connected the pre-amp to our sound bar. It was quick and simple, and the sound is flawless. This worked just perfectly for our needs, and it didn’t break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Horrible sound quality. Tried to connect a turntable (Audio-Technica AT-LP60X) to my sound bar. Sound was unbearable. Will continue to route my turntable through my TV (then to soundbar) until I find a better preamp. This one is going back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGal

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: If you have an older record player and a newer amplifier without a "Phono" input, you need one of these pre-amps to boost the sound. This does exactly what it needs to do at a good price. There's no OFF switch or any sort of indicator that it is plugged in so you sort of have to be ok leaving this on or remembering to turn it off when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is designed to do - works as a pre-amp for a turntable to feed into a home theater box, at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great (although I've only had it for a couple of weeks). I retired an old, old Pioneer stereo amp and replaced it with a modern low-end digital home theater box. The new box has AM and FM as well as other inputs (both HDMI and RCA). But it expects all inputs to be "line level". So I needed a pre-amp for my turntable that would boost its output to line-level. This box does exactly that, and comes with a small power supply. It has RC inputs and outputs.
customer_reviews.author: David A Wehnes

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed it to do
customer_reviews.text: Does what I needed it to do, bring the output from a turntable up to line in level. It may not be audiophile quality but it more than suffices to make an old turntable useable with the input to a tabletop stereo system. Can’t comment on durability but out of the box it works well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: ... I already have a newer home theater system with great sound, so I needed some way to add ...
customer_reviews.text: My old amp/tuner needs work and I already have a newer home theater system with great sound, so I needed some way to add my turntable to the system. This little puppy did the trick. Got it in today, hooked it into my home theater system and my turntable into it, and Voila! The sound is crystal clear and so far, I have not had to hook up the ground cable, but I probably will once I figure out where to permanently set up the turntable. I don't have any history yet, but at first blush, this little guy is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Fan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. All I got was buzzing. Called a professional out in case it was an error on my part and he said lot of these no-work amplifiers are sold to people who don't return them because the low cost is not worth the trouble of driving all the way across town to a UPS store. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: My old vinyl records sound great. The only reason I took off one star
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to hook up my 40+ year old Pioneer PL-10 to my current receiver, however, since it lacked a phono input, I needed a pre-amplifier to bring the turntable signal up to line strength. This little unit filled the bill perfectly. My old vinyl records sound great. The only reason I took off one star, is because the Pyle has no on/off switch, so if I don't want it to always be , "on", I have to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: figsgrandpa

customer_reviews.title: A good preamp.
customer_reviews.text: It works! I bought it to boost the signal for my Stanton STR8-80 turntable through a Philips receiver. There isn’t as much bass as I’d hoped but that may be the receiver’s fault. It’s small and compact and simple to hook up. Though, the power brick is a tad large. Maybe find a way to shrink that a bit, and maybe add a longer cord to it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Watson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: So I've been running this pre amp for the past hour on various styles of music. Honestly my first impressions are pretty low. The music sounds muffled and output is very low. Figured I'd try the "el cheapo" in the hopes it would meet my expectations. I'd say don't waste your time or money on this thing. You get what you pay for. I'll keep it going until I buy a replacement and update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: Everything sounds great. I have it hooked up to a $150 record player, but that goes to a nice Onkyo amp and really nice paradigm speakers. I think it would sound better with a nicer record player but a nicer record player probably has its own pre amp. Feels a little cheaply built but hey it just sits on the shelf behind the amp doesn't need to survive a tough mudder run or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Brought my old LPS back to life
customer_reviews.text: Onkyo receiver with no phono output. Used this Pyle preamp plugged into tape output and now my records play. Sounds good but not as good as my cds. Remember though some of my LPS are 50 years old. If you want to hear those old tunes then this is a great device and for the price you have nothing to lose
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad At All
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these for a friend. I Giving them one of my turntables as a gift but they don’t have a phono input on their receiver. I gotta tell you, I expected the worst but honestly the sound is pretty damn good. I tried my best to do an A/B with the phono on an old marantz receiver (because I have no life) and the difference is noticeable but not awful by any means. Every time I went back to this one it didn’t sound “bad” it just sounded “less”. Worth picking up and would be an astounding difference if you’re coming from a cheap turntable with a built in preamp to something better + this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get your records up and running.
customer_reviews.text: This product just arrived today and from the surface, it looks and feels like a very well made product. I will have it hooked up shortly to give a full review. Update: HOOKED UP and it works great! Super clean and easy to hook up. First record on was "Signals" from Rush. It sounds so nice. For being just a few bucks I am very impressed. I noticed some preamps for well over $100 and I am not sure I would notice the difference on my old LP player. If I updated the player? Probably still wouldn't notice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Very nice preamp
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for an old Yamaha turntable, and this work beautifully. No issue setting up, no humming noise. Just a black box, nothing fancy. This preamp does with it suppose to do, nothing more, nothing less. Will upgrade to a better model Preamp, once I purchase a new turntable. Worth it; could not be more happy.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for no phono inputs
customer_reviews.text: My Old Technics DD record player was resurrected with this Pyle unit to boost signal to my not as old Denon. Now I am totally satisfied with listening to my 40 year old record collection on my system.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This little box allows me to play my turntable through a tube amp that does not have a "phono in" jack. I dont know what the quality of the sound is compared to a $400 preamp, but it sounds good to me for the $17 that it cost.
customer_reviews.author: Hozer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Turntable was super quiet previously
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Turntable was super quiet previously, did some research and found out that a preamp was needed to connect to the AV Receiver. I was turned off by a lot of the higher prices, but I found this one for a great price and decided to give it a shot. It works like a dream, the table is loud, the ground is stable, I would definitely recommend this to future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Vt Artist

customer_reviews.title: Solid Phono Pre-Amp at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: No volume control, this system is a plug and play to boost your Record Player sound. Most turntables do not come with preamp and without one is quite as all heck. With it however it is easily heard and no noticeable interference either. There is an included ground slot to help reduce the crackle of old records.
customer_reviews.author: Stewie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I needed a turntable pre-amp since my new receiver didn’t have one. The Pyle is perfect, simple, very inexpensive. Connected quickly, worked well. I have other Pyle products (small amplifiers) and this one, too, fills a welcome niche inside the ever-more complicated world fo electronics.
customer_reviews.author: MIKES

customer_reviews.title: Super simple and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Broke out my memories from storage. Technics turntable and vinyl is back. My Marantz was doa decades ago. No volume at all on Yamaha surround system. Hooked up this preamp and dislocated my left hip within the first hour. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mehle

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: It is small, rough 2 1/2 x 3 1/2 so it fits behind my turntable. It also has a ground screw for the ground wire on the turntable, and it has rubber feet (small but functional). The sound quality is more than adequate. My Jazz records sound smooth and relaxing. More animated music has good clear highs and plenty of punch. I would recommend even for my youith audiophile equipment, Marantz, McIntosh, Thorens, and Klipsch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McWold

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure, per-amp or cartridge...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I had a new still in the carton 1996 Kenwood turntable but it wouldn't work with my 1999 receiver, wasn't sure if it was the cartridge, needle or pre amp so I took a shot and went for the pre amp. Man am I glad I did. I hooked it up as per instructions and as if by magic it worked like a champ. Volume perfect, tone perfect and the price was excellent. Thanks Pyle for a great product...PYLE PP999 PRE AMP WITH GROUND CONNECTION AND A/C ADAPTER INCLUDED. Plye sent me a free gift just for buying a product I needed, what company does that, I love these guys. Extremely customer oriented, their the best!
customer_reviews.author: arlene jiuliani

customer_reviews.title: It's an adequate "starter" pre-amp if you're just getting back into turntables...
customer_reviews.text: If you just want to be able to play your records, this will do fine as a bridge between your TT and an amp. If you're an audiophile looking to get a pristine feed of your classic vinyl records, this will leave you feeling let down. The sound is pretty hollow and just not all that great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Steinke

customer_reviews.title: Used to connect soundbae
customer_reviews.text: Used this to connect my record player (doesn’t have built in speakers) to my sound bar. Without this could barely hear the record player when on max volume through my sound-bar but with the preamp to connect the cords, all works accordingly!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Within it's price range, I'd give 5/5. It works perfectly for the average listener that doesn't feel the need for a more expensive style of preamp. Good line level boost and good ground. If that's all you need, order one. If you'd like to color/warm up your audio a bit more, look elsewhere. Otherwise, I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. C. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little pre amp. No bells, No whistles. Just performance. EZ to install. No issues in the construction or the performance. IF you are looking to bring that old turntable back to life and aren't excited about spending a lot more money, give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Scalf

customer_reviews.title: Gives Good Loud Audio Levels for my Turntable
customer_reviews.text: Works great as I expect it to. It brings my almost inaudible record player audio level to as loud as a regular CD player in my receiver system with no Phono inputs. It's cheap and works great. Sound is clear, bass is pumpin, volume levels are amped good for my Pioneer PL-530 turntable.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Works well with a nice 1980’s NAD turntable into a recent Harmon Kardon receiver that had HDMI, wireless internet, but no phono pre-amp. This little device with an included AC converter was a cheap solution.
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: Nice little box,that works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: My 1978 Pioneer turntable sounds just as good if not better than brand new Pro-ject with phono stage build in. Pyle PP999 does it job inexpensively and easily.
customer_reviews.author: Family Account

customer_reviews.title: Solid pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: Great pre-amp, simple to use and very compact. I bought this for an old turntable that I've had for years and only recently got serious about setting up. I needed a pre-amp to connect it to my tube amp and when looking around online I found this PP999 for a great price on amazon and knowing its Pyle made I knew that it was a good investment, there were a few cheaper options and also another Pyle product and there were also much more expensive options available. I'm not an audiophile but I think I made the best possible decision by purchasing this PP999.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K.

customer_reviews.title: Brings a vintage turntable to life
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. It’s exactly what I needed to make the phono signal from an old Hitachi PS-10 turntable I recently came across loud enough to listen to on a modern Bluetooth speaker. No noise introduced, audio is crystal clear. Couldn’t be happier. Plus it’s a radically more inexpensive alternative to buying a new $300 stereo system with a built-in preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Preamp!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like good quality, easy connection, sound is awesome, works as it is intended! Made my 20 year old turntable sound fantastic! I forgot how much better vinyl's sound over digitized, no comparison!
customer_reviews.author: Bernfunctional

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: When I needed to replace a very old pre-amp, I took a chance on the Pyle PP999, and was pleasantly surprised. The unit is very compact, very easy to connect between the turntable and PC, and has no perceivable noise floor. Excellent product, even if it were at a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Noyes

customer_reviews.title: WOrked beautifully
customer_reviews.text: the repair shop couldn't figure it out, but my dad told me to buy this part, and it worked beautifully and totally saved my turntable so i can now listen to my vinyl again, and actually HEAR it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: An affordable preamp that is easily outclassed
customer_reviews.text: This amplifier is good for anyone in need of a cheap phono preamp. Please note however that it is just that - cheap. I found the preamp to have a slight hum with my system, and that bass was lacking, and there didn't seem to be much clear stereo separation. I ended up returning this preamp and getting the ART DJ Pre II which is a much better product. For anyone with lower-quality speakers, like using a soundbar with their turntable, this preamp should work fine. For anyone with more musical speakers, like Monitor Audio Radius and a good turntable (like U-Turn Orbit or Pro-Ject), I'd recommend going with the ART to get the most out of your components.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Walczak

customer_reviews.title: Makes vinyl sound live with the right table!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a short term review until updated in the next few months! 20160912: Purchased this after buying an older turntable (pioneer pl-115d) and needing one. Iten arrived as specified and actually had a grounding spot on it so dunno what some people were complaining over. Maybe earlier products didnt have this... Hooked up easy but do wish the power cord was another foot longer for my purposes. Other than that it's a solid buy and you wont be dossapointed!
customer_reviews.author: meathead1986

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it’s supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I have an old JVC turntable that doesn’t have an amp and my home theater system doesn’t have a phono input, so there’s no amp there either. This preamp does exactly what it says. There’s no noise either and I didn’t have to ground it. Overall I’m quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Fluri

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is totally awful. It’s pretty pathetic when your internal speakers produce a higher sound quality than this with external speakers. I should’ve known better given the price. But if you like buzz and trash sound quality this is the one for you! It’s amazing there are so many positive reviews for this thing cause it’s total garbage. I never leave reviews but this is not worth it. Stay a way and invest in something that actually does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Serves me well.
customer_reviews.text: Got an old turntable (jvc) which my 9 yr old decided to acquire from me... but, needed to hookup to the boom box. Needed the preamp, got this used... very happy. Good sound, small and I did it about as cheap as possible. For the price, I have nothing to complain about. Long live vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: MRvinylGUY

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Perfect to link between phono output and digitizer to get my old LPs to disk. Only complaint is that the ground nut was impossible to turn by hand, but turned fine with 3mm wrench
customer_reviews.author: me in dc

customer_reviews.title: Phono Pre-Amp for Turntables
customer_reviews.text: I bought this preamp for my old Garrard AT60 Turntable. Works great. Easy to connect to the computer and I run two albums through the turntable and boy did the sound come out great. Created mp3 files for our van to play my music where ever I go. LP's are in good shape and didn't even have to try to remove and noise. If you are looking for an easy way to get your LP music to CD's then this is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Old Froggy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I own a 30 year old Pioneer turntable. I did not trust the needle/cartridge, since it had been stored for more than 20 years. Over the years, I replaced the original Pioneer Receiver with a Sony. Since this was listed as a phono pre-amp, I assumed it met RIAA standards. I tried going straight from the magnetic cartridge, but the amplifier is needed. However, the frequency spectrum is NOT full range. Some of the sound is distorted. Would I buy this, knowing what I know now. The answer is an definite "NO".
customer_reviews.author: James L. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Pyle low noise and compact turntable pre-amplifier
customer_reviews.text: The Pyle turntable preamplifier works like a charm with no noise or hum and the metal case is good at shielding RF interference, a compact and unobtrusive unit. I can play my LP albums again. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: SustainAbility Man

customer_reviews.title: It's a crapshoot.
customer_reviews.text: 1st one did not work but on one channel. The second worked fine. Unfortunately I lost the paperwork on the 1st one and a certain big box store was not inclined to help.(BB) spent way too much on this and should have just bit the financial bullet and gone for quality.
customer_reviews.author: DARYL COLLINS

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff- small high pitch noise sometimes
customer_reviews.text: The product does exactly what I wanted it to do. The only issue is that the power supply wall outlet emits a high pitch noise. I gave it a little wack it is not as noticeable as I can only hear it when I am adjusting cables behind the tv now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little Pyle pre-Amp product to use with a Reel to Reel tape deck that it's own amplifier went out. The deck has a line out but the output is so small that it must have a pre-amp to work with the aux input on any other device that I have and this little pre-amp works great! I love it! The sound quality is wonderful and I can now enjoy my old reel to reel tapes. Thanks Pyle and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Zoltek

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but creates a strong hum
customer_reviews.text: Great product that works well with our old record player that is connected to a Sonos Amp. What I dislike, the power adapter makes a loud humming noise. Similarly, when the power is supplied to the pre-amp, it creates a humming noise in our speakers. It's not a power issue (new electrical in the house). At this point, I leave the power cable unplugged when not using the record player. Will need to do some research to solve the humming noise.
customer_reviews.author: K Patel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic setup, sound quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is just what I needed to listen to my old record collection again. My old receiver had a phono input and amp built in, but it conked out on me. I purchased a new receiver (Also from Pyle, and also a great unit) but it had no phono input, (most of today's receivers don't!) But this little guy filled that void beautifully. Quickly attached between turntable and new receiver, and I can blast my oldies again (Sorry, neighbors!) Awesome sound quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Syms

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as I Hoped For
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to hook up my record player to my stereo system (which does not have a phono input). I use an RCA stereo audio cable to conned my record player to this pre-amp. I then use a RCA stereo audio to a 3.5mm auxiliary cable to connect this to my stereo system. I have not needed a ground wire and the everything sounds great. I haven't noticed any interference. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a phono pre-amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jose H

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly solid item for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This item is solidly built, and the sound is quiet and clear. I have only used it for a few hours, so cannot judge much on reliability yet but out of the box it seems like a bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Haley

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE INSTALLING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: YOU MUST RUN A GROUND WIRE FROM THE RECORD PLAYER TO THIS PRE AMP OR IT WILL SOUND LIKE A PYLE OF SHI. I did not have the original ground wire that fit my Technics record player so I found an old steel spring and stretched it some what straight and jammed it into the ground port on my record player. Then unscrewed the ground post on preamp and attached the other end and screwed her back in. I almost gave up with this preamp cause the hum was so bad but now it has NO hum! A lot of people blame the preamp but I can assure you their issue was with the operator!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, surprised at the clarity
customer_reviews.text: This is a little fella, about the size of an iPhone 4 and twice as thick. Works perfectly, easy to set up and use right away. The ground wire screw is small and SLICK so no bare wire can work here as it just squishes out as you tighten the screw. Works best if you crimp a fork connector on the end of your ground wire and tighten it to that.
customer_reviews.author: Danno210

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Technics SL-B5 that doesn’t have a built in preamp. We finally got around to purchasing this one so we can play it through our stereo and I can’t believe we waited so long! I’ve never used a preamp and wouldn’t call myself very savvy when it comes to things like this, but the connection was very intuitive and I had the whole thing up and running beautifully in under 5 minutes. Such a great purchase for only $15!
customer_reviews.author: Sqysh

customer_reviews.title: Better for Less $$
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, perfect sound for cheap, cheap, cheap, preamp. I had bought a Mounkey mpamp1 .. don’t waste your time on it.. this Pyle is great
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R

customer_reviews.title: Small, function, inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to hook my turntable up to my Sonos Play 5 (which then broadcasts my records to the rest of the Sonos speakers in my house). This isn’t fancy, but it’s cheap and it’s always on so it makes using it for this function even easier.
customer_reviews.author: SpartytimeExcellent!

customer_reviews.title: I love playing my old vinyl records on my newer surround sound system.
customer_reviews.text: The PP999 phono preamp worked as promised. The sound quality is excellent and the volume output is adequate. Now I can listen to all of my "antique" vinyl records through my surround system at acceptable sound levels. I'm thrilled. I'm planning to have a vinyl record party to show off my collection and give my friends a chance to show off their favorite vinyl records!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought so I could continue to use my high quality turntable with a new receiver that does not have built in phono amp. Works very well. I am happy with the sound quality also.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Does the Trick for Me
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick perfectly for me. Read the other reviews to understand there are complaints about the low output level and a certain number of DOA's. So what? For under $15 bucks you take your chances. Mine works perfectly and I am glad to get my turntable back into operation after a 10 year hiatus. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Old Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got it connected 3 days ago and at this point I am very pleased. I have old equipment and was concerned, after reading some of the reviews, if this was what I needed. It left me very pleased. I seem to hear a slight hum when a record is not playing but that is not a problem. I don't hear it unless I listen carefully for it. Again, very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: cvpills

customer_reviews.title: Great preamp
customer_reviews.text: Works great to adapt my old Denon turntable with a newer Yamaha unit. It has the ground point which is a nice touch. The sound quality is really good and I didn't notice any audible interference despite being nestled amongst a bunch of AV equipment. My turntable lives again!
customer_reviews.author: PMG757

customer_reviews.title: Ground screw stripped first use, but otherwise a nice value
customer_reviews.text: Sounds pretty decent for the price. No audible hum or anything like that. But the fact that the ground screw (knurled connector bolt thing) stripped the first use makes me doubt their quality. It was the screw itself that stripped -- I replaced it with a 2mm(?) phillips headed screw and I'm back in business.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Sea

customer_reviews.title: Based Upon prior purchases
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not yet had the opertunity to use the pre-amp, based upon my prior purchase of a Pyle Cassette Deck I'm sure the unit will perform admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Ski

customer_reviews.title: Very nice low cost phono preamp
customer_reviews.text: Much lower noise than my Audio Technica's built- in preamp. Unit is solid metal and has a weight to it. Also nice they include an AC adapter with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Admin_Dude42

product_meta.title: Pyle Phono Turntable Preamp - Mini Electronic Audio Stereo Phonograph Preamplifier with RCA Input, RCA Output & Low Noise Operation Powered by 12 Volt DC Adapter - PP999
product_meta.description:
Style:SinglePylePro Model : PP999

COMPACT ULTRA-LOW NOISE PHONO TURNTABLE 
COMPACT ULTRA-LOW NOISE PHONO TURNTABLE PREAMP WITH 12-VOLT ADAPTOR - PREAMPLIFIER
Converts Phono Signals to Line Level Signals12-Volt DC 110V Adaptor IncludedDedicated RCA ConnectorsOutput Level: 2V Reference Voltage: 1V Load Impedance: 10K OhmsS/N Ratio (with A-WTD): 70 dB T.H.D. : 0.08 for 1 KHz 3 mV InputFrequency Response:20 Hz ~ 20 KHz ±2dBInput Sensitivity / Impedance / Phono - 3 mV / 50K OhmsDimensions (W x H x D):3.54'' x 2.13'' x 1.02''Weight : 0.88 Lbs
This electronic preamplifier stands up to the test and will provide you with serious sound performance. The PP999 is perfect for bringing your studio equipment's phono-level output to a more suitable and manageable line-level output. It'll take your audio signal, amplify its strength and prepare it for further processing by your receiver or amplifier. Preamps technically provide voltage gain to your desired equipment and are key to assisting the signal source. The ultra-low noise audio conditioning circuitry allows the preamp to boost audio to levels that are more manageable for various types of audio equipment. You'll find it easier to adjust the recording level volumes of different sources and instruments alike. You should position your preamp close to the source to reduce unwanted noise and interference. Preamps can sometimes come built into the stereo equipment, but if that's not the case, the PP999 is an easy install, wise choice and great addition to any musician or producer. Take your sounds and audio production skills to the next level with the PP999 Preamplifier.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER


& PP444 PP555 PP999 PHE300 PHE400 Turntable / Phono Pre-Amplifiers Noise / Hum Eliminators Jacks RCA & 1/4'' RCA & 1/4'' RCA 1/4'' TRS 1/4'' TRS & XLR 12V DC Adaptor ✔ ✔ ✔
feature_bullets: CONVERTS PHONO SIGNALS: A turntable preamp that converts phono signals to Line Level Signals. This state-of-the-art circuitry phono preamp can accommodate magnetic pickups with an input sensitivity of 3mV at 50K Ohms

LOW NOISE OPERATION: Offers outstanding performance with it’s Low-Noise Audio Operational Amplifiers. The output is 2V max (P-P) at 10K Ohms. It’s better to position the preamp close to the source to reduce unwanted noise and interference

CONNECTS TO TURNTABLES: Connect any turntable to modern sound equipment without specialized phono input for amplifying music. For the receiver, this can be connected to speakers, computers, laptops and more
SIMPLE PLUG & PLAY: This mini preamp has stereo RCA inputs and stereo RCA outputs. Connect the turntable to the RCA inputs and ground. Then, connect the amplifier receiver to the RCA outputs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,407 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
